title: How to Make a Sweet Potato and Marshmallow Casserole

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (175° Celsius).
Boil the sweet potatoes.
steps.description: Place the sliced potatoes and water into a large saucepan. Have the potatoes boil until tender, taking about 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain the potatoes and mash them with a potato masher.
steps.description: Pour the mashed potatoes in a large bowl.

steps.headline: Blend in the butter, brown sugar, orange juice, and cinnamon using a hand and or electric mixer.
steps.description: Beat until the potatoes are fluffy and creamy.

steps.headline: Pour the sweet potato mixture on to a  9 x 13 inch baking tray.
steps.description: Spread it out using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the marshmallows over the potatoes.
Bake the casserole for about 25-30 minutes, until the marshmallows are golden brown and the potatoes are soft.
Serve.
steps.description: Let the casserole cool for about ten minutes. Cut a piece of the casserole using a knife. Place it on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 350° Fahrenheit (175° Celsius).  Boil the sweet potatoes. Place the sliced potatoes and water into a large saucepan. Have the potatoes boil until tender, taking about 15 minutes. Drain the potatoes and mash them with a potato masher. Pour the mashed potatoes in a large bowl. Blend in the butter, brown sugar, orange juice, and cinnamon using a hand and or electric mixer. Beat until the potatoes are fluffy and creamy. Pour the sweet potato mixture on to a  9 x 13 inch baking tray. Spread it out using a rubber spatula. Sprinkle the marshmallows over the potatoes.  Bake the casserole for about 25-30 minutes, until the marshmallows are golden brown and the potatoes are soft.  Serve. Let the casserole cool for about ten minutes. Cut a piece of the casserole using a knife. Place it on a serving plate. Enjoy!
